Paul is right.

To further explain what "not entirely functional" means, in the branch 
(1) customizing jobs requires manually editing configuration files in a 
new format; (2) most 1.X web UI features are not yet ported, though 
there is more you can do via JMX; (3) there are various 'loose ends' of 
incomplete functionality to be completed. Thus it's still for 
adventurous developers curious about the crawler internals.

As soon as the branch web UI reaches rough parity with the web UI of 
1.X, so that expert users who can run from SVN snapshots/auto-builds 
would be comfortable exploring, the branch will be merged back into the 
SVN trunk.

When the changes are stable enough for our standard suite of crawls, it 
will become a 2.0.0 candidate release and then official release. Even 
then, those running regular crawls, and familiar with the old Heritrix, 
may choose to linger on 1.12.1 for a while, rather than immediately 
taking the adjustment hit. Major new functionality in frontier 
configuration and control is planned for 2.2 about 2 months after 2.0.

So:
- 1.12.1 is the latest-and-greatest official release
- SVN trunk is still 1.12.1-based
- 2.0.0 work is underway in the 'pjack_settings' branch, but would be a 
challenging way to get started with Heritrix until this work comes back 
into trunk

Hope this helps you make the right choice for your interests,

- Gordon @ IA

Paul Jack wrote:
> Heritrix 2.0 development is proceeding in the svn branch  
> pjack_settings. It started as an experimental branch before we  
> decided to make that branch 2.0.
> 
> The pjack_settings branch will be moved to trunk in a matter of  
> weeks. Until then, the branch should be stable, but not entirely  
> functional. The pjack_settings branch does build using maven 2.0.
> 
> -Paul
> 
> On Jun 6, 2007, at 3:59 PM, Andrew Serff wrote:
> 
>> This may be a dumb question but I can't seem to find an answer  
>> anywhere.
>> There is mention of work being started on heritrix 2.0 on the wiki.  
>> I'm
>> just getting started with heritrix and want to be using the latest and
>> greatest. When I checkout and build from svn, it says it is still like
>> 1.13.x. I also saw mention that you are moving from maven 1.x to 2.x
>> and the trunk of svn (heritrix) still only builds with maven 1.x. Am I
>> looking in the wrong place? let me know!
>>
>> Thanks!
>> Andrew
